symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.AnalyticMap
symbols.description:
The AnalyticMap control. This control renders a Map based on a GeoJSON source. The GeoJSON file is searched in the following places in the given sequence:

  • <server>:<port>/sap/bc/vbi/geojson/L0.json
  • ./media/analyticmap/L0.json
Further it is possible to specify a different URL by setting static attribute sap.ui.vbm.AnalyticMap.GeoJSONURL.
The Features from the GeoJSON get rendered as neutral background in gray. They are not active, but may report a name via tooltip. Each feature is expected to have a property id or id2, where as id2 should be an ISO country according to ISO 3166-2.
By adding Region elements to the regions aggregation it is possible to make feature from the GeoJSON interactive. Region elements need to match by ISO code.

aggregations.name: regions
aggregations.description: Regions that are different from the defaults. It is possible to specify the tooltip and color for regions. The region code must match the GeoJSON id2 identifier.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.vbm.AnalyticMap

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.Area
symbols.description:
Specific Visual Object element for an Area. An Area is a filled polygon, which border is given as a list of geo-coordinates. Areas can have multiple disjunct parts as well as each part can have an arbitrary number of exclusions/holes.
The inner part and the edges of areas are interactive and fire events on click.
Since the actual size of an area depends on the zoom level it might be only partly visible. Thus detail windows will open at the click position.

properties.name: borderDash
properties.description: Defines the dashing style of the area border using an array.

properties.name: color
properties.description: The fill color of the Area.

properties.name: colorBorder
properties.description: The border color of the Area.

properties.name: position
properties.description:
The position array for the Area. For single part areas the format is "lon0;lat0;0.0;...;lonN,latN,0.0". For multi part areas you need to provide an array of arrays of the above position string: "[['lon0...'],['lon0...']]" (sequence of single and double quotes is important). Single and Multi part areas must not be mixed within one Areas aggregation.
Finally each area part can have multiple exclusions/holes. In that case the position list of excluded areas has follow the list of the base shape: "['lon0...', 'exLon0...']".

The position array for the Area. For single part areas the format is "lon0;lat0;0.0;...;lonN,latN,0.0". For multi part areas you need to provide an array of arrays of the above position string: "[['lon0...'],['lon0...']]" (sequence of single and double quotes is important). Single and Multi part areas must not be mixed within one Areas aggregation.
Finally each area part can have multiple exclusions/holes. In that case the position list of excluded areas has follow the list of the base shape: "['lon0...', 'exLon0...']".

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.Box
symbols.description:
Specific Visual Object element for a Box. A Box is a rectangle, which is positioned with its centerpoint at the given position. The ratio between width and height can be controlled with property scale. Depending on the property fxsize a box has an absolute or relative size.
Since the actual size of a box may depend on the zoom level it might be only partly visible. Thus detail windows will open at the click position.

properties.name: color
properties.description: The color of the box.

properties.name: colorBorder
properties.description: The border color of the box.

properties.name: position
properties.description: The position of the Box. The format is "lon;lat;0".

properties.name: scale
properties.description: The scale of the box. The format is "x-Scale;y-Scale;z-Scale" whereas z-Scale is currently ignored.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.Cluster
symbols.description: Cluster control to visualize clustered objects on a map. The Cluster control does not cluster anything itself, instead it only shows a predefined image. The image can be configured with the properties type, color, icon and text. If a text is given it is shown in the upper right corner of the control with a rounded border around. With the color property any color can be chosen. The type property overwrites a property color with semantic color of the type and provides a particular semantic icon in the middle of the control. With the icon property an icon can be defined and may overrule the semantic icon; if no icon is defined ( and no type) then the semantic icon for type inactive is chosen.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Set the color of the control. If a type is set then the semantic color of the type is taken instead.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Set the icon of the control. If a type is set then the semantic icon of the type can be overwritten with this property. If no icon and no type is set then the icon for the semantic type 'inactive' is taken.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Set the text of the control.

properties.name: type
properties.description: semantic type for cluster. The type specifies the icon and the color of the cluster control.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.vbm.Cluster

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.ClusterBase
symbols.description:
Abtract base class for Clustering types. This element implements the common part for all specific Cluster elements. It must not be used directly, but is the base for further extension.
There are two optional aggregations: vizTemplate and vizVo determining how cluster objects should be visualized. Only the one or the other should be provided.
With aggregation vizTemplate you can provide an arbitrary SAPUI5 control for the actual visualization. If you want this control to display the number of clustered object you need to provide the name of the receiving property of the template via property textProperty. For interaction with the cluster you can either use the events provided by the visualization template or, if it does not provide appropriate events, the cluster element events click and contextMenu. The event handler will receive an instance of sap.ui.vbm.ClusterContainer.
With aggregation vizVo you provide an instance of sap.ui.vbm.Spot as visualization object. Spots are based on an image. The text for the number of clustered objects needs to be placed over the image. The actual color, font, size, and positioning of the text can be influence via property textSettings. For interaction with the cluster you can use the events provided by the spot.

properties.name: areaAlwaysVisible
properties.description: Flag controlling the visibility of the area convered by a cluster object.

properties.name: areaColor
properties.description: Fill color for the area covered by a cluster object

properties.name: areaColorBorder
properties.description: Border color for the area covered by a cluster object

properties.name: rule
properties.description: Clustering rule, describing which visual objects should be considered for clustering

properties.name: textProperty
properties.description: Name of property of the visualization control receiving the number of clustered objects. This setting applys only if aggregation vizTemplate is used.

properties.name: textSettings
properties.description: Settings for the text placed on the given Spot telling the number of clustered objects. This setting applys only if aggregation vizVo is used. If omitted the number of clustered object will not be shown!

aggregations.name: vizTemplate
aggregations.description: Optional: Instance of a control, which is used as template for visualizing cluster objects. This is the prefered choise.

aggregations.name: vizVo
aggregations.description: Optional: Instance of a spot, which is used as template for visualizing cluster objects

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.ClusterContainer
symbols.description:
Specific Visual Object element acting as a container for cluster visualization objects. A ClusterContainer is positioned at a calculated position on the map. It aggregates a visualization controls, which will then move with the map.
Since a ClusterContainer is not a real visual object most features borrowed from VoBase and event Container will not work. There is no label, no edit mode, and no drop support. Events like click may only be fired if the aggregated control is not handling them. The properties are not changeable as well as the aggregated item. Only read access is possible

This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type sap.ui.vbm.Container can be used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.ClusterDistance
symbols.description:
Cluster definition element for distance based clusters. Visual objects are clustered based on the visible distance between them. Objects get aggregated to a cluster object as long as they are inside the given distance range to the start object. The start object for a cluster is not specifically defined, just the next object not belonging to a cluster is taken. The visualization objects are placed in the center of gravity of the covered objects. Thus the actual distance between them may vary.
This clustering is fast, but the results may not be very convincing.

properties.name: distance
properties.description: Distance in pixels between cluster objects. This distance is used as parameter during the clustering. The visualization objects are placed in center of gravity of the covered objects. Thus the actual distance between them may vary.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.ClusterGrid
symbols.description: Cluster definition element for grid based clusters. Visual objects are clustered based on a grid. It is possible to have multiple grid based clusters. The visualization object is placed in the center of the grid cell plus a given offset.

properties.description: Space between grid cells if cell area is shown

properties.name: gridSize
properties.description: Size of grid cells in pixels. Format is "distanceX;distanceY"

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Minimal number of objects covered by grid cell fullfilling the cluster rule until clustering is applied.

properties.name: limitTotal
properties.description: Minimal total number of objects covered by grid cell until clustering is applied.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Offset for the visualization object from the center of the grid cell. This can be used to show multiple visualization objects in on grid cell without overlapping. Format is "offsetX;offsetY"

properties.name: orderIndex
properties.description: Ordering index of given cluster in the sequence of all grid based clusters

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.ClusterInfoType
symbols.description:
Cluster Info Type

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/vbm/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'ClusterInfoType'.

properties.name: sap.ui.vbm.ClusterInfoType.ChildCluster
properties.description: Type indicating that Cluster Info should return info on child cluster nodes (next LOD). This is only supported for tree clustering.

properties.name: sap.ui.vbm.ClusterInfoType.ContainedVOs
properties.description: Type indicating that Cluster Info should return only VOs covered by the Cluster object

properties.name: sap.ui.vbm.ClusterInfoType.Edges
properties.description: Type indicating that Cluster Info should return info on Edges of the Voronoi Area for the cluster. This is only supported for tree clustering. Edges not merged with rectangles.

properties.name: sap.ui.vbm.ClusterInfoType.NodeInfo
properties.description: Type indicating that Cluster Info should return info on cluster node itself.

properties.name: sap.ui.vbm.ClusterInfoType.ParentNode
properties.description: Type indicating that Cluster Info should return info on parent cluster node (previous LOD). This is only supported for tree clustering.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.ClusterTree
symbols.description: Cluster definition element for tree clusters. Complex clustering based on Voronoi diagrams. The actual clustering is based on the areas in the Voronoi diagram and cluster objects get aggregated to a hierarchy over several levels of detail.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.Container
symbols.description:
Specific Visual Object element acting as a container for other controls. A Container is positioned at the given position on the map. It can aggregate other controls, which will then move with the map.
Since a Container is not a real visual object most features borrowed from VoBase will not work. There is no label, no edit mode, and no drop support. Events like click will only be fired if the aggregated control is not handling them.

properties.name: alignment
properties.description:
Alignment of the container to its position:

  • 0: center
  • 1: top center
  • 2: top right
  • 3: center right
  • 4: bottom right
  • 5: bottom center
  • 6: bottom left
  • 7: center left
  • 8: top left

properties.name: position
properties.description: The position for the Container. The format is "lon;lat;0".

aggregations.name: item
aggregations.description: The control that should be placed in the container.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.FeatureCollection
symbols.description:
FeatureCollection aggregation container. A FeatureCollection can render the content of an assigned GeoJSON. The naming is associated to the GeoJSON standard. All features found in the GeoJSON are rendered as separated objects. From the possible feature types only

  • Polygon and
  • Multipolygon
are supported so far. The feature type support will be extended in the upcoming releases.
All features from the GeoJSON will be rendered with the given default colors and are inactive. They do not react on mouse over, except with tooltip, or raise any events on click or right click.
By adding Feature elements to the items aggregation you can make the match (by id) feature from the GeoJSON interactive and give it alternative colors.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.GeoJsonLayer
symbols.description:
GeoJsonLayer aggregation container. A GeoJsonLayer can render the content of an assigned GeoJSON. The naming is associated to the GeoJSON standard. All features found in the GeoJSON are rendered as separated objects. From the possible feature types only

  • Polygon and Multipolygon,
  • LineString, and
  • Point
are supported so far. The feature type support will be extended in the upcoming releases.
All features from the GeoJSON will be rendered with the given default colors and are inactive. They do not react on mouse over, except with tooltip, or raise any events on click or right click.
By adding Feature elements to the items aggregation you can make the match (by id) feature from the GeoJSON interactive and give it alternative colors.
The GeoJSON can be given as a URL using property srcURL, directly as object using property data, or as a combination of both.

properties.name: data
properties.description: GeoJSON object according to the http://geojson.org/geojson-spec.html#geojson-objects|specification or array of such objects

properties.name: defaultBorderColor
properties.description: Default border color for GeoJSON features, if applicable (Polygons and LineStrings)

properties.name: defaultFillColor
properties.description: Default Fill color for GeoJSON features (Polygons and LineStrings)

properties.name: defaultLineWidth
properties.description: Default line width for LineStrings

properties.name: srcURL
properties.description: Source URL for GeoJSON

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

symbols.title: class sap.ui.vbm.GeoJsonLayer

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.GeoMap
symbols.description:
Map control with the option to position multiple visual objects on top of a map. The GeoMap control shows an image based map loaded from one or more configurable external providers. Per default a map from MapQuest is used. Other map providers can be configured via property mapConfiguration. Multiple maps can be mashed up into one map layer stack. If multiple map layer stacks are provided via configuration it is possible to switch between them during runtime. The control supports the display of copyright information for the visible maps.
On top of the map the GeoMap control provides a navigation control, a scale, and a legend. Each of them can be switched off separately.
It is possible to set the initial position and zoom for the map display. Further the control allows to restrict the potentially visible map area and zoom range.
Different visual objects can be placed on the map. Visual objects are grouped in VO aggregations and an arbitrary number of VO aggregations can be assigned to the vos aggregation.
The second aggregation featureCollections allows the use of GeoJSON as source for visual objects.

properties.name: centerPosition
properties.description: Center position of the Map. Format is "<longitude>;<latitude>".

properties.name: clustering
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.31. This property should not longer be used. Its functionality has been replaced by the clusters aggregation.

properties.name: disablePan
properties.description: Disable Map Paning. This setting works only upon initialization and cannot be changed later on.

properties.name: disableZoom
properties.description: Disable Map Zooming. This setting works only upon initialization and cannot be changed later on.

properties.name: enableAnimation
properties.description: Enable Animation of Map Zoom. Works in combination of setZoomlevel.

properties.name: initialPosition
properties.description: Initial position of the Map. Set is only supported on initialization! Format is "<longitude>;<latitude>;0".

properties.name: initialZoom
properties.description: Initial zoom. Value needs to be positive whole number. Set is only supported on initialization!

properties.name: legendVisible
properties.description: Toggles the visibility of the legend

properties.name: mapConfiguration
properties.description: This is the map configuration for the geo map. The map configuration defines the used maps, the layering of the maps and the servers that can be used to request the map tiles.

properties.name: navcontrolVisible
properties.description: Defines the visibility of the navigation control. Only supported on initialization!

properties.name: refMapLayerStack
properties.description: Name of the map layer stack (provided in mapConfiguration) which is used for map rendering. If not set the layer stack with the name 'Default' is chosen. Property can be changed at runtime to switch between map layer stack.

properties.name: scaleVisible
properties.description: Defines the visibility of the scale. Only supported on initialization!

properties.name: visualFrame
properties.description: Visual Frame object. Defining a frame {minX, maxX, minY, maxY, maxLOD, minLOD} to which the scene display is restricted.

properties.name: zoomlevel
properties.description: Zoomlevel for the Map. Value needs to be positive whole number.

aggregations.name: featureCollections

deprecated.text: This aggregation should not longer be used. Its functionality has been replaced by the more genericgeoJsonLayers aggregation.

aggregations.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.31. This aggregation should not longer be used. Its functionality has been replaced by the more genericgeoJsonLayers aggregation.

aggregations.name: geoJsonLayers
aggregations.description: Aggregation of GeoJSON layers. Object from a GeoJSON layer will be behind all other Visual Objects from the vos aggregation. In case of multiple GeoJSON layers the objects are orderer with the layers they belong to.

aggregations.name: resources
aggregations.description: Aggregation of resources. The images for e.g. Spots have to be provided as resources.

aggregations.name: vos
aggregations.description: Aggregation of visual object types. A VO aggregation can be considered to be a table of VOs of a common type.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.vbm.GeoMap

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.Heatmap
symbols.description: Type specific Visual Object aggregation for HeatPoint instances.

properties.name: alphaExponent
properties.description:
Exponent for the alphaChannel
aE = 1 : alpha Channel remains linear
0 < aE < 1 : (e.g. aE=0.5 "square root") sub linear alpha channeling (lower value colors remain longer visible; range appears wider)
aE > 1 (e.g. aE=2: "squared") above linear alpha channeling ( lower value colors remain shortly visible; range appears chopped)

properties.name: behavior
properties.description: Behavior of the HeatPoint, 0 Density Map, 2: Heat Map, 1: Intermediate.

properties.name: colorExponent
properties.description:
Exponent for the color
aE = 1 : Linear Gradient
0 < aE < 1 : Sublinear Gradient; i.E. with cE=0.5 point values are square rooted before usage [share of lower value cols will decrease]
aE > 1 : Higher Level Gradient; i.E. with cE=2 point values are squared before usage [share of lower value cols will increase]

properties.name: gradient
properties.description:
Gradient Definition. Can be either provided as Ressource - then it is type string.
Or as Array [n0,c0,n1,c1,...,nk,ck] (ni > ni-1; ci respective colors) with an arbitrary number of color stops as in the following
Example: [0,'rgba(0,255,0,1)',220,'rgba(255,255,0,1)',255,'rgba(255,0,0,1)']

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: Opacity of the heatmap.

Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.vbm.Heatmap with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.vbm.VoAbstract.extend.

methods.name: getAlphaExponent

returnValue.description: Value of property alphaExponent

methods.description:
Gets current value of property alphaExponent.

Exponent for the alphaChannel
aE = 1 : alpha Channel remains linear
0 < aE < 1 : (e.g. aE=0.5 "square root") sub linear alpha channeling (lower value colors remain longer visible; range appears wider)
aE > 1 (e.g. aE=2: "squared") above linear alpha channeling ( lower value colors remain shortly visible; range appears chopped)

Default value is '1.0'.

methods.name: getBehavior

returnValue.description: Value of property behavior

methods.description:
Gets current value of property behavior.

Behavior of the HeatPoint, 0 Density Map, 2: Heat Map, 1: Intermediate.

Default value is '2'.

methods.name: getColorExponent

returnValue.description: Value of property colorExponent

methods.description:
Gets current value of property colorExponent.

Exponent for the color
aE = 1 : Linear Gradient
0 < aE < 1 : Sublinear Gradient; i.E. with cE=0.5 point values are square rooted before usage [share of lower value cols will decrease]
aE > 1 : Higher Level Gradient; i.E. with cE=2 point values are squared before usage [share of lower value cols will increase]

Default value is '1.0'.

methods.name: getGradient

returnValue.description: Value of property gradient

methods.description:
Gets current value of property gradient.

Gradient Definition. Can be either provided as Ressource - then it is type string.
Or as Array [n0,c0,n1,c1,...,nk,ck] (ni > ni-1; ci respective colors) with an arbitrary number of color stops as in the following
Example: [0,'rgba(0,255,0,1)',220,'rgba(255,255,0,1)',255,'rgba(255,0,0,1)']

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.LegendItem
symbols.description: Aggregation element for the Legend. A LegendItem consists of marker and an associated text. The marker is either a rectangle in the given color or the given image or a semantic spot type. If no marker but only a text is provided then it is shown in italic letters and can be regarded as a header.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.Pie
symbols.description:
Specific Visual Object element for a Pie Chart. A Pie is a round chart, which is positioned with its centerpoint at the given position. The size of the pie can be controlled with property scale. The slices of the pie chart are defined by the aggregated PieItem elements. The detail window will open at the center of the pie.
The property hotDeltaColor borrowed from VoBase is applied only to the hot PieItem and not the whole pie.

properties.name: position
properties.description: The position of the Pie.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: The scaling of the Pie. The scale must be a vector "x-Scale;y-Scale;z-Scale", but currently only the x scaling is applied to the Pie.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: PieItem object aggregation. A PieItem holds the data for one slice in a Pie.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.Resource
symbols.description: A resource is a Base64 encoded representation of an image binary that can be referenced by name in e.g. a Spot element. When images are specified as a string resource it is guaranteed that the control can access the bits in the image. If just a URL to the resource is given it is loaded and converted to a Base64 encoded binary. This happens asynchronously and it may require several re-renderings of the control until all resource show up correctly.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the resource. The name should be always used when a resource is referenced.

properties.name: src
properties.description: URL to an image. It is important that the image data is readable fom the visual business control. Therefore e.g. images coming from a local drive or cross domains are not allowed. The preferred way is to use the Base64 encoded data provided using the value property.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value of the resource. Base64 endode binary.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.vbm.Resource

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.Route
symbols.description:
Specific Visual Object element for a Route. A Route is a polyline, which is given as a list of geo-coordinates. In order to indicate direction an arrow head can be added at start and end. Further it is possible to have a dot at each point of the coordinate list.
Since the actual length of a route depends on the zoom level it might be only partly visible. Thus detail windows will be dynamically positioned in the middle of the visible route part.
A Route supports GeoMap internal drag'n drop with fine grained control on matching drag sources and drop targets. A drag'n drop operation is possible if any type in the drag source aggregation of the dragged visual object matches a type in the drop target aggregation of the target vo. Drag source and drop target types defined on element level apply only for a single element instance, except the element is used as template.

properties.name: color
properties.description: The color of the route.

properties.name: colorBorder
properties.description: The border color of the route.

properties.name: directionIndicator
properties.description: Set to true if intermediate triangles along the route should show the direction only applicable if arrow head is defined ( start and/or end ) it is not recommended to use line dots in addition because the direction indicators generate additional line points at their head and base positions

properties.name: dotbordercolor
properties.description: The border color of the line dots of a route.

properties.name: dotcolor
properties.description: The color for the line dots of a route.

properties.name: dotwidth
properties.description: The diameter of a dot in a route.

properties.name: end
properties.description:
The end point type of the route.

  • 0: no endpoint
  • 1: arrow as endpoint

properties.name: lineDash
properties.description:
Defines the dashing style of the route using an array. The first value gives the length of the stroke and the second the length of the gap. Thus "1;1", would result in a doted line. However, strokes are painted with rounded endings. Thus the actual stroke length depends also on the line width. As a sample a stroke of 1 pixel length and a line width of 6 will result in at least 6 pixels total length. In that case the line dashing should be set to "1;6" for an equal length of stroke and gap!
The line dashing array can be extended to achive more complex pattern, e.g. "1;1;5;2" and so on.

properties.name: linewidth
properties.description: The width of the route line. With width 0 no line is drawn.

properties.name: position
properties.description: The position array of the route. The format is "lon0;lat0;0;...lonN;latN;0".

properties.name: routetype
properties.description: Defines the type of the route, default is 'Straight'. Other types are 'Geodesic' which show the shortest path between two points, e.g. flightroutes

experimental.text: this method is experimental and might be modified or removed in future versions.

properties.name: start
properties.description:
The start point type of the route.

  • 0: no startpoint
  • 1: arrow head as startpoint

parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

Defines the dashing style of the route using an array. The first value gives the length of the stroke and the second the length of the gap. Thus "1;1", would result in a doted line. methods.name: setLineDash

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sLineDash
parameters.description: New value for property lineDash

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property lineDash.

Defines the dashing style of the route using an array. The first value gives the length of the stroke and the second the length of the gap. Thus "1;1", would result in a doted line. However, strokes are painted with rounded endings. Thus the actual stroke length depends also on the line width. As a sample a stroke of 1 pixel length and a line width of 6 will result in at least 6 pixels total length. In that case the line dashing should be set to "1;6" for an equal length of stroke and gap!
The line dashing array can be extended to achive more complex pattern, e.g. "1;1;5;2" and so on.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.vbm.Route

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.Routes
symbols.description:
Type specific Visual Object aggregation for Route elements.
Routes support GeoMap internal drag'n drop with fine grained control on matching drag sources and drop targets. A drag'n drop operation is possible if any type in the drag source aggregation of the dragged visual object matches a type in the drop target aggregation of the target vo. If drag source and drop target types are defined on aggregation level they apply for all aggregated elements.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.Spot
symbols.description:
Specific Visual Object element for a Spot. A Spot is actually an image drawn at the given position. There are two modes for using spots:

  • A controlled mode by providing a spot type. In this mode many properties for the spot are automatically set by programmed defaults according to the Fiori guidelines.
  • A freestyle mode, providing the full control on colors and layout.
Beside the visualization with an image a spot can have an icon or text, which can be controlled and positioned using the content properties.
A Spot supports GeoMap internal drag'n drop with fine grained control on matching drag sources and drop targets. A drag'n drop operation is possible if any type in the drag source aggregation of the dragged visual object matches a type in the drop target aggregation of the target vo. Drag source and drop target types defined on element level apply only for a single element instance, except the element is used as template.

properties.name: alignment
properties.description:
Alignment of the spot to its position:

  • 0: center
  • 1: top center
  • 2: top right
  • 3: center right
  • 4: bottom right
  • 5: bottom center
  • 6: bottom left
  • 7: center left
  • 8: top left

properties.name: contentColor
properties.description: The color of the content ( icon or text ).

properties.name: contentFont
properties.description: The font of the spot's text. If icon is used then the font is automatically set to"SAP-icons".

properties.name: contentOffset
properties.description: The offset from the center of the image where to place the content ( text or icon ) in x;y- direction

properties.name: contentSize
properties.description: The font size to be used for text or icon

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The icon to be rendered on the spot. Note that either text or icon may be displayed ( not both together ). Use the CharCode-Id of SAPUI5-Icons (e.g.: "\ue146")

properties.name: image
properties.description: The image for the spot. This must be a reference to a resource.

properties.name: imageSelected
properties.description: The image for the spot when selected. This must be a reference to a resource.

properties.name: position
properties.description: The position of the spot. The format is "lon;lat;0"

properties.name: scale
properties.description: The scale of the spot. The format is "x-Scale;y-Scale;z-Scale". The z-Scale is curretly ignored.

properties.name: text
properties.description: The text that is displayed on the spot. The text should not exceed a few characters. Note that either text or icon may be displayed ( not both together ).

properties.name: type
properties.description: Spot type for semantic spots. A given semantic type will overrule settings for image, scale, and content.

parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

symbols.title: class sap.ui.vbm.Spot

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.Spots
symbols.description:
Type specific Visual Object aggregation for Spot elements.
Spots support GeoMap internal drag'n drop with fine grained control on matching drag sources and drop targets. A drag'n drop operation is possible if any type in the drag source aggregation of the dragged visual object matches a type in the drop target aggregation of the target vo. If drag source and drop target types are defined on aggregation level they apply for all aggregated elements.

properties.description: Set to true if position may be changed at runtime. The actual changeability is control on each aggregated element with property changeable.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.vbm.Spots

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.VBI
symbols.description:
The VBI control. This is the Visual Business base control, which is mainly intended to communicate directly with the Visual Business Backend API in a proprietary JSON format. This control should not be used directly in a client side application. For this the control extension sap.ui.vbm.GeoMap is recommended.
The main or high level API of the VBI control is made of

  • method load for sending JSON to the control for processing, and
  • event submit returning a result JSON as parameter data containing actual event information and changed data.
Further the high level API provides the thumbnail support.
Additionally the control offers a low level API made of several events, like render, zoom, move and so on, which allow to render application specific content directly on the controls canvas.

properties.description: When true, the ActiveX plugin version of Visual Business will be used for rendering. For that the plugin needs to be installed on the client. Default (false) the control renders on canvas.

The event is raised before a Visual Business window is opened. It is intended to be used to place arbitrary content in e.g. a Detail Window. This event is not supported in plugin mode.

returnValue.description: Cluster Info Object with requested info according to given Cluster Info Type

parameters.name: sIdent
parameters.description: Cluster Id

parameters.name: iType
parameters.description: Type of information which should be returned

methods.description:
Retrieve information on a specific cluster object.

Type :

  • 0 : contained VOs
  • 1 : child clusters (tree clustering only)
  • 2 : parent Node (tree clustering only)
  • 10 : Information on Node
  • 11 : Edges of the Voronoi Area (tree clustering only, not merged with rectangle)

returnValue.description: Base64 encoded picture (PNG format) on success, "" otherwise

parameters.name: iMode
parameters.description: 0: Overlay only; 1 (default) and 3: include Labels; 2 and 3: try to include maps (will return "" if not possible)

methods.description: Returns a Screenshot of the Overlay. Please note that the map cannot be included due to browser restrictions. Function returns the visible part of the Canvas excluding map, copyright info, navigation control, scaler, legend, detail windows, container elements. Analytic Maps are returned as they are not treated as "maps" internally. Modes 2 & 3 are experimental, trying to load the map (this may work on inhouse servers with adapted settings, standard configurations should fail)

methods.name: zoomToAreas

parameters.name: aAreaList
parameters.description: List of Area Ids to zoom to.

parameters.name: corr
parameters.description: . This correction factor deals with the space which is reserved to the div borders. The Correction factor can be expressed either in a fracture (e.g. 0.9, this means 10% space to the borders) or array of pixel values (order left, top, right, bottom) for the added margin of the calculated zoom area, e.g. [450,150,0,0] which keeps a left border of 450 pixels and a top border of 150 pixels.

methods.description: Zoom to one or multiple Areas. This function works only for the main geo scene in the Visual Business control.

methods.name: zoomToGeoPosition

parameters.name: fLon
parameters.description: Longitude in degrees. This can also be an array of longitude values.

parameters.name: fLat
parameters.description: Latitude in degrees. This can also be an array of latitude values.

parameters.name: iLod
parameters.description: Level of detail, usually between 0 and 20. This will be limited by the map provider capabilities.

methods.description: Zoom to one or multiple geo positions. This function works only for the main geo scene in the Visual Business control.

symbols.title: abstract class sap.ui.vbm.VoAggregation

symbols.name: sap.ui.vbm.VoBase
symbols.description:
Abstract aggregation element for VO aggregations. This element implements the common part for all specific VO elements. It must not be used directly, but is the base for further extension.
As a common feature it provides the Label, which may be attached to any visual object. There are two modes for using labels:

  • A controlled mode by providing a label type. In this mode most parameters for the label are automatically set by programmed defaults according to the Fiori guidelines.
  • A freestyle mode, providing the full control on colors and layout.
Further all visual objects have common edit capabilities and it is possible to drop content on visual objects.

properties.name: changeable
properties.description: Set to true if VO is changeable. Which properties are actually changeable can be controlled on the related VO aggregation.

properties.name: dragData
properties.description: Data to be dragged. This property allows you to provide an arbitrary data string, which is transfered to the target in a drag'n drop operation

properties.name: entity
properties.description: The visual object builds an entity/group with other VO elements when it is hovered. The property is not supported when the PlugIn is used.

properties.name: fxdir
properties.description: The visual object is not rotated when the map is rotated. The property is only required when the PlugIn is used and only meaningful for some VOs.

properties.name: fxsize
properties.description: The visual object should keep its size when the map is zoomed. Default value is 'true'. Only meaningful for some VOs.

properties.name: hotDeltaColor
properties.description:
Color change applied when visual object is hovered. The format is RHLSA(<hue>;<lightness>;<saturation>;<opacity>). The hue shift is given in degree (0 to 360). The other parameters are given as multipliers, where 1 means the component remains unchanged.
Beside the delta color approach it is also possible to specify an absolute color in the usual CSS color formats (except named colors).

properties.name: hotScale
properties.description: Scaling factor applied when visual object is hovered. This is only supported on selected VOs, which do not present a defined geo area.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Unique identifier for the object. This is optional. If not provided the default identifier sId is used. However, sId is generated if template binding is used and thus it is not stable. Provide the key if the object really needs to have a unique and stable identifier.

properties.name: labelArrow
properties.description: The visual objects label arrow. For left/right/top/bottom aligned labels an additional arrow points to the label's object.

properties.name: labelBgColor
properties.description: The visual objects label background color. The default value is white.

properties.name: labelBorderColor
properties.description: The visual objects label border color. The default is no border.

properties.name: labelPos
properties.description:
The visual objects label position. This property determines the positioning of the label relative to the VO it belongs to. Possible values are:

  • 0: centered
  • 1: top
  • 2: top right
  • 3: right
  • 4: bottom right
  • 5: bottom
  • 6: bottom left
  • 7: left
  • 8: top left
The default alignment is VO specific.
For multiple position based VOs, like Route, or Area the label is dynamically positioned. If the current display of a VO consists of multiple disconnected parts, each part gets an own label.

properties.name: labelText
properties.description: The visual objects label text. Providing a label text required, but also sufficient the get a label displayed.

properties.name: labelType
properties.description: Type for semantic labels. A given semantic type will overrule color settings and add an icon.

properties.name: select
properties.description: Set to true if the element is selected

properties.name: selectColor
properties.description: Color change applied when visual object is selected. This can be explicit or a relative one. See above.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vbm.VoBase itself.

This event is raised when the design handle is right clicked.

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.vbm.VoBase itself

This event is raised when the design handle is moved.

methods.name: sap.ui.vbm.VoBase.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.vbm.VoBase with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Element.extend.

methods.name: getChangeable

returnValue.description: Value of property changeable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property changeable.

Set to true if VO is changeable. Which properties are actually changeable can be controlled on the related VO aggregation.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getDragData

returnValue.description: Value of property dragData

methods.description:
Gets current value of property dragData.

Data to be dragged. This property allows you to provide an arbitrary data string, which is transfered to the target in a drag'n drop operation

methods.name: getEntity

returnValue.description: Value of property entity

methods.description:
Gets current value of property entity.

The visual object builds an entity/group with other VO elements when it is hovered. The property is not supported when the PlugIn is used.

methods.name: getFxdir

returnValue.description: Value of property fxdir

methods.description:
Gets current value of property fxdir.

The visual object is not rotated when the map is rotated. The property is only required when the PlugIn is used and only meaningful for some VOs.

Default value is 'true'.

methods.name: getFxsize

returnValue.description: Value of property fxsize

methods.description:
Gets current value of property fxsize.

The visual object should keep its size when the map is zoomed. Default value is 'true'. Only meaningful for some VOs.

Default value is 'true'.

methods.name: getHotDeltaColor

returnValue.description: Value of property hotDeltaColor

methods.description:
Gets current value of property hotDeltaColor.

Color change applied when visual object is hovered. The format is RHLSA(<hue>;<lightness>;<saturation>;<opacity>). The hue shift is given in degree (0 to 360). The other parameters are given as multipliers, where 1 means the component remains unchanged.
Beside the delta color approach it is also possible to specify an absolute color in the usual CSS color formats (except named colors).

Default value is 'RHLSA(0;1.3;1.0;1.0)'.

methods.name: getHotScale

returnValue.description: Value of property hotScale

methods.description:
Gets current value of property hotScale.

Scaling factor applied when visual object is hovered. This is only supported on selected VOs, which do not present a defined geo area.

Default value is '1.0;1.0;1.0'.

methods.name: getKey

returnValue.description: Value of property key

methods.description:
Gets current value of property key.

Unique identifier for the object. This is optional. If not provided the default identifier sId is used. However, sId is generated if template binding is used and thus it is not stable. Provide the key if the object really needs to have a unique and stable identifier.

methods.name: getLabelArrow

returnValue.description: Value of property labelArrow

methods.description:
Gets current value of property labelArrow.

The visual objects label arrow. For left/right/top/bottom aligned labels an additional arrow points to the label's object.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getLabelBgColor

returnValue.description: Value of property labelBgColor

methods.description:
Gets current value of property labelBgColor.

The visual objects label background color. The default value is white.

Default value is 'RGB(255;255;255)'.

methods.name: getLabelBorderColor

returnValue.description: Value of property labelBorderColor

methods.description:
Gets current value of property labelBorderColor.

The visual objects label border color. The default is no border.

methods.name: getLabelPos

returnValue.description: Value of property labelPos

methods.description:
Gets current value of property labelPos.

The visual objects label position. This property determines the positioning of the label relative to the VO it belongs to. Possible values are:

  • 0: centered
  • 1: top
  • 2: top right
  • 3: right
  • 4: bottom right
  • 5: bottom
  • 6: bottom left
  • 7: left
  • 8: top left
The default alignment is VO specific.
For multiple position based VOs, like Route, or Area the label is dynamically positioned. If the current display of a VO consists of multiple disconnected parts, each part gets an own label.

methods.name: getLabelText

returnValue.description: Value of property labelText

methods.description:
Gets current value of property labelText.

The visual objects label text. Providing a label text required, but also sufficient the get a label displayed.

methods.name: getLabelType

returnValue.description: Value of property labelType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property labelType.

Type for semantic labels. A given semantic type will overrule color settings and add an icon.

Default value is None.

methods.name: sap.ui.vbm.VoBase.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.vbm.VoBase.

methods.name: getSelect

returnValue.description: Value of property select

methods.description:
Gets current value of property select.

Set to true if the element is selected

Default value is false.

methods.name: getSelectColor

returnValue.description: Value of property selectColor

methods.description:
Gets current value of property selectColor.

Color change applied when visual object is selected. This can be explicit or a relative one. See above.

Default value is 'RHLSA(0.0;1.0;1.0;1.0)'.

methods.name: openContextMenu

parameters.name: oMenu
parameters.description: The context menu to be opened. The object is expected the have an attribute

methods.description: Open the context menu. The method relies on the state saved before firing event contextMenu. Further the object oMenu is expected to be the one given as parameter menu of event contextMenu.

methods.name: openDetailWindow

parameters.name: sCaption
parameters.description: Caption of detail window

parameters.name: sOffsetX
parameters.description: Position offset in x-direction from the anchor point

parameters.name: sOffsetY
parameters.description: Position offset in y-direction from the anchor point

methods.description: Open a Detail Window for the visual object at click position. The method relies on the state saved before firing event click.
